channel.title: Astronomer of the Day
channel.description: RSS feed of the astronomer of the day.

item.title: Jérôme Lalande
item.description: Joseph Jérôme Lefrançois de Lalande (French: [lalɑ̃d]; 11 July 1732 – 4 April 1807) was a French astronomer, freemason and writer. He is known for having estimated a precise value of the astronomical unit (the distance from the Earth to the Sun) using measurements of the transit of Venus in 1769.
